subject: Art & Design
title: The Aesthetic-Usability Effect
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: The Aesthetic-Usability Effect.

hook.text: Users rate beautiful designs as easier to use â€” even when they're not. Attractiveness biases perceived usability.

buildup.text: The aesthetic-usability effect: people tolerate more usability issues in products that look visually appealing.

discovery.text: A study compared two ATM interfaces. Same functionality.

twist.text: This creates a dangerous trap: beauty can mask bad design. Users struggle but blame themselves, not the product.

climax.text: The best products invest in both: beautiful AND usable. Beauty earns patience; usability earns loyalty.

punchline.text: Beauty buys forgiveness. But it doesn't fix broken experiences.

quiz.question: What is the aesthetic-usability effect?
options: Users perceive beautiful designs as easier to use, even when they aren't
Beautiful designs are always more usable
Users ignore aesthetics and focus only on function
